author: schone_wizard
content: does the fact that people won't be able to withdraw their deposits for sometime (until phase 1.5) present a scenario where if we have a bug like we had with Medalla, where people lost 3% of their deposits, they'll leave their validators running just because the other option is a complete freeze of their assets? Meaning, during phase 0-1.5, we have an artificial incentive to keep validating, but from phase >1.5 such incentive will be removed, and in which a reoccurance of a bug wiping 2-3% of peole's assets, this time they would choose to withdraw their funds and go seek better financial instruments to make up their losses

author: schone_wizard
content: kinda went around in a circle, but my basic question is, does not being able to withdraw, combined with a bug, during phase <1.5 hide/obscure from us the true reality of economic incentives validators will have when ETH2.0 is a complete system
